LevelDBView Repo is a fast key-value storage library written at Google. Think of it like a simple database where you store pieces of data (values) associated with unique names (keys). Itâ€™s designed to be very fast for both writing new data and reading existing data, and it reliably stores everything on disk. It uses a log-structured merge-tree (LSM-tree) design to achieve high write performance and manages data in sorted files (SSTables) across different levels for efficient reads and space management.
